summary: Solid rocket motor (SRM) propulsion systems play an important role in the nation's defense. Using a solid propellant that expels hot gases when combusted, SRMs provide the thrust behind a variety of DOD's missiles—from short-range tactical missiles to longer-range strategic ones. But the industrial base for SRMs has shifted. U.S. manufacturers have consolidated, and foreign-owned manufacturers have entered the market. According to one estimate, the...
title: Solid Rocket Motors: DOD and Industry Are Addressing Challenges to Minimize Supply Concerns
